metadata.title: CVE-2024-50349 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Printing unsanitized URLs when asking for credentials made theuser susceptible to crafted URLs (e.g. in recursive clones) thatmislead the user into typing in passwords for trusted sites thatwould then be sent to untrusted sites instead

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-50349` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-all - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-cvs - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-daemon-run - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-email - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-gui - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-man - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-mediawiki - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
git-svn - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
gitk - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
gitweb - 1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.34.1-1ubuntu1.12').
